author: William Upton
title: 'Louisiana Woman' Suing to Keep Trump Off Ballot is Self-Described 'Neo-Communist' & Democrat Party Operative.
text: A Louisiana woman has [filed](https://lailluminator.com/2023/12/27/chalmette-woman-files-suit-to-keep-trump-off-louisiana-ballot-report/) a state lawsuit with the goal of kicking Donald Trump off the stateâ€™s March 23rd Republican presidential ballot. Presented simply as a Louisiana citizen by establishment news outlets, Ashley Reeb is, in fact, a self-described â€œneocommunistâ€ and member of St. Bernard Parish Democrat Executive Committee. Reebâ€™s lawsuit, filed on December 22nd, claims: â€œBoth Trumpâ€™s actions (engaging in insurrection) as well as his inaction (giving aid and comfort to insurrectionists) on Jan. 6, 2021, disqualify him from holding any office of/under the United States.â€ Ms. Reebâ€™s legal claims echo those dismissed by state supreme courts in [Minnesota](https://thenationalpulse.com/2023/11/08/minnesota-supreme-court-dismisses-suit-calling-for-trump-to-be-barred-from-ballot/) and [Michigan](https://thenationalpulse.com/2023/12/27/winning-michigan-supreme-court-rejects-trump-ballot-ban-case-brought-by-soros-hamas-linked-group/). According to her LinkedIn [profile,](https://archive.ph/W1Szd) Ms. Reeb works as seasonal staff with the The New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival and Foundation, Inc. From 1999 to 2005 she served as a part-time Administrative File Clerk with the Louisiana National Guard, and as a Deputy with the St. Bernard Parish Sheriffâ€™s Office from 2001 to 2003. An examination of Ms. Reebâ€™s social media [account](https://twitter.com/DatParishGirl) on X (formerly Twitter) reveals she is a follower and reposter of a whose-who of â€˜ResistanceLibâ€™ accounts. Reeb herself has [pushed](https://archive.ph/UVb6e) the debunked Russiagate conspiracy theory as recently as August 21st, 2023. In addition, she has [posted](https://www.facebook.com/ashleybreeb/posts/pfbid0FNzKaLSQz4Q81EghpNJWm5cLqbH5aaCzYFFZ5TJpKVwE1YneRg7Lo2E3E5yyFUqul) pro-Hamas propaganda on her Facebook page, claiming Israeli hostages were well treated by their Hamas terrorist captors and even â€˜thankedâ€™ them â€“ with additional claims it is Israelis who have engaged in mass kidnappings of Palestinians. According to local [reports](https://thehayride.com/2023/12/meet-the-insane-chalmette-leftist-suing-to-keep-trump-off-the-louisiana-ballot/), Ms. Reeb flies both a transgender flag and a Black Lives Matter flag outside her home. "They KNOW he is a fucking prolific criminal, and they are mostly too chickenshit to call him out for it." Simple answer: Russian kompromat. The RNC was hacked when the DNC was. Interestingly, that's about the time when they all fell in line ðŸ¤” [https://t.co/JzuktoEQag] â€” Ash (@DatParishGirl) [August 21, 2023]

organizations.name: st. bernard parish democrat executive committee

author: ABNewswire
title: Jolly Results Launches Specialized Digital Marketing Services
text:
Jolly Results Launches Specialized Digital Marketing Services for HVAC, Plumbing, and Roofing Contractors Across the U.S. 07-31-2025 07:00 AM CET | Business, Economy, Finances, Banking & Insurance
Press release from: ABNewswire
Image: https://www.abnewswire.com/upload/2025/07/315d847976595b9dc710534b9ae44502.jpg
Jolly Results, a newly launched digital marketing agency, is making waves in the home services industry with its exclusive focus on HVAC, plumbing, and roofing contractors across the United States. After more than eight years of behind-the-scenes experience working as SEO specialists for established marketing agencies, the team at Jolly Results is stepping out on its own with a promise: to deliver fast, effective, and lead-driven marketing solutions tailored to the needs of home service professionals.
Built from the ground up to understand the unique challenges of local contractors, Jolly Results offers a complete digital growth package that includes professional website design, Local SEO, and Google & Local Services Ads (LSA) and has been designed to generate consistent leads and help contractors dominate their local markets.
"We're not here to offer generic websites or cookie-cutter campaigns," a company spokesperson said. "Everything we create is built for speed, performance, and the specific needs of HVAC techs, roofers, and plumbers who rely on leads to keep their business running."
Through a simplified four-step process: audit, launch, generate, and scale, Jolly Results brings results in record time. Websites go live within seven days, ads start generating leads within 24 to 48 hours, and Local SEO campaigns begin showing results within the first 30 to 60 days.
Real contractors are already seeing the difference. In Phoenix, an HVAC company reported a 340% increase in leads and tripled their revenue within eight months. A Dallas roofing contractor generated $2.8 million in new business from storm-related Google Ads campaigns. And in Denver, a plumbing contractor now ranks #1 for high-intent local search terms like "emergency plumber near me," thanks to Jolly Results' Local SEO strategy.
Jolly Results offers customized solutions for each trade. HVAC websites highlight emergency contact features and seasonal services. Plumbing campaigns focus on emergency repairs, water heater installations, and trust-building content. Roofing strategies are optimized around storm damage, insurance claims, and urgent roof repairs. Each campaign is carefully designed to address the real-time needs and search behaviors of homeowners in the contractor's local area.
More than just another marketing agency, Jolly Results is positioning itself as a long-term partner to contractors who are serious about scaling. Its service packages are priced transparently, with websites starting at $1,497, Local SEO at $997/month, and Google/LSA Ads at $1,497/month, and include full strategy, implementation, and ongoing optimization.
"Our mission is simple," said the company's spokesperson. "We help home service businesses generate more leads, close more jobs, and grow their revenue faster, without the runaround."
Contractors interested in working with Jolly Results can start with a free marketing audit and consultation to assess their current online presence and get a tailored strategy for local market domination.
About Jolly Results
Jolly Results is a U.S.-based digital marketing agency built exclusively for HVAC, plumbing, and roofing contractors. With years of experience and deep industry specialization, Jolly Results helps home service businesses grow their lead flow, improve their visibility, and increase revenue through data-driven websites, SEO, and Google Ads campaigns.
To learn more, visit www.jollyresults.com [ https://www.jollyresults.com/ ].
For the latest updates, follow Jolly Results on social media:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jollyresults
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/jolly-results/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jollyresults/
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@JollyResults
X @JollyResults
Media Contact
Company Name: Jolly Results
Contact Person: Sarah
Email:Send Email [ https://www.abnewswire.com/email_contact_us.php?pr=jolly-results-launches-specialized-digital-marketing-services-for-hvac-plumbing-and-roofing-contractors-across-the-us ]
Country: United States
Website: http://www.jollyresults.com

ABNewswire makes no warranties or responsibility or liability for the accuracy, content, images, videos, licenses, completeness, legality, or reliability of the information contained in this article. author: Juan Escobar FernÃ¡ndez
title: Promesa que hizo el Gobierno Petro de reducir el precio de los servicios pÃºblicos seguirÃ¡ sin cumplirse: esta es la razÃ³n - Infobae
text:
El servicio de agua es esencial para los colombianos, por lo que una regulaciÃ³n de precios les caerÃ­a muy bien a los consumidores, debido a que en los Ãºltimos meses el precio de las facturas ha llegado muy alto en diferentes regiones - crÃ©dito Colprensa El Gobierno de Gustavo Petro reconociÃ³ el 27 de junio que la tan esperada reforma a los servicios pÃºblicos, que ademÃ¡s de garantizar el mÃ­nimo vital, incluirÃ¡ disposiciones sobre la estructura tarifaria, la mejora en la calidad del servicio, y polÃ­ticas de sostenibilidad energÃ©tica, aÃºn estÃ¡ en fase de construcciÃ³n, a pesar de haber sido anunciada hace un aÃ±o.
El ministro de Minas y EnergÃ­a, AndrÃ©s Camacho, hizo el anuncio durante su participaciÃ³n en el segundo dÃ­a del Congreso de la AsociaciÃ³n Nacional de Empresas de Servicios PÃºblicos y Comunicaciones (Andesco), en Cartagena.
Ahora puede seguirnos en nuestro WhatsApp Channel y en Facebook.
â€œAÃºn no la hemos socializado del todo porque hemos venido haciendo los ajustes. El presidente nos ha pedido que hagamos una ley robustaâ€, mencionÃ³ el ministro al referirse a los motivos por los que la iniciativa todavÃ­a no se dio a conocer de forma completa. SegÃºn Camacho, que serÃ­a uno de los jefes de gabinete que saldrÃ­a del cargo esta semana, el proyecto buscarÃ¡ garantizar el mÃ­nimo vital y definir claramente los deberes y derechos de los ciudadanos.
AndrÃ©s Camacho Morales, ministro de Minas y EnergÃ­a, asegurÃ³ en el Congreso de Andesco que fue un gran logro haber superado el fenÃ³meno de El NiÃ±o - crÃ©dito Andesco ReducciÃ³n del texto En rueda de prensa, el funcionario confirmÃ³ que el articulado de la reforma se redujo de manera significativa. â€œPasamos de tener 200 artÃ­culos a unos 50 postulados en una nueva versiÃ³nâ€, indicÃ³ el ministro. La reducciÃ³n es parte de los ajustes que el equipo de Gobierno hace para presentar una propuesta mÃ¡s sÃ³lida.
El proyecto de ley aÃºn se encuentra en proceso de ajustes y se espera que sea presentado durante la prÃ³xima legislatura, que inicia el 20 de julio. Esta fecha serÃ¡ fundamental, ya que marcarÃ¡ el momento en que la iniciativa se someterÃ¡ a consideraciÃ³n y debate en el Congreso de la RepÃºblica.
Los colombianos se quejan de manera constante de los excesivos cobros en el servicio de luz - crÃ©dito Colprensa â€œLa reforma es fundamental para garantizar la sostenibilidad y eficiencia de los servicios pÃºblicos en Colombia,â€ aÃ±adiÃ³ el ministro al dejar claro que la intenciÃ³n del Gobierno es crear un marco legal que responda de forma adecuada a las necesidades de la poblaciÃ³n y asegure la calidad de los servicios ofrecidos.
Ajuste y socializaciÃ³n Durante su intervenciÃ³n, el ministro resaltÃ³ tambiÃ©n la importancia de la participaciÃ³n ciudadana en el proceso de ajuste y socializaciÃ³n del proyecto. â€œLa opiniÃ³n de los ciudadanos es clave para construir una ley que verdaderamente cumpla con las expectativas y necesidades del paÃ­sâ€, enfatizÃ³.
Cabe mencionar que la reforma a los servicios pÃºblicos es una promesa de campaÃ±a del presidente Petro, quien insistiÃ³ en la necesidad de una regulaciÃ³n mÃ¡s equitativa y eficiente. Es asÃ­ que el Gobierno trabaja en la elaboraciÃ³n de una ley que no solo beneficie a todos los ciudadanos, sino que tambiÃ©n se ajuste a los estÃ¡ndares internacionales de calidad y sostenibilidad.
PolÃ©mico borrador de la reforma a los servicios pÃºblicos En febrero de 2024, se filtrÃ³ un borrador de una propuesta que busca reformar la regulaciÃ³n de los servicios pÃºblicos en el paÃ­s, lo que suscitÃ³ un intenso debate sobre la intervenciÃ³n estatal en dichos servicios. En el documento se establece que â€œla regulaciÃ³n de los servicios pÃºblicos estÃ¡ a cargo del presidente de la RepÃºblica, quien puede ejercer esta funciÃ³n directamenteâ€. La revelaciÃ³n planteÃ³ inquietudes respecto al impacto que podrÃ­a tener en la estructura regulatoria existente.
Pese a que estÃ¡ establecido en la ConstituciÃ³n PolÃ­tica, el Consejo de Estado no le permitiÃ³ al presidente Gustavo Petro ser quien regulara los servicios pÃºblicos, medida que quiso tomar en febrero de 2024 - crÃ©dito Ricardo Maldonado Rozo/EFE Por eso, el presidente de Andesco, Camilo SÃ¡nchez, expresÃ³ en ese entonces su oposiciÃ³n a la propuesta. SegÃºn SÃ¡nchez, el proyecto â€œdesconfÃ­a de la estructura regulatoria que tiene el paÃ­s y prÃ¡cticamente quiere abolirlaâ€. ResaltÃ³ la importancia de la regulaciÃ³n actual, que permite una participaciÃ³n equitativa de empresas pÃºblicas, privadas y mixtas , lo que ha sido crucial para el Ã©xito del modelo vigente.
SÃ¡nchez tambiÃ©n manifestÃ³ su descontento con la manera en que se gestionÃ³ hasta ese momento el proceso de reforma, por lo que indicÃ³ que se habÃ­a estado trabajando hacia una construcciÃ³n concertada del proyecto. Sin embargo, apuntÃ³ que la Ãºltima versiÃ³n del texto seguÃ­a ignorando aspectos fundamentales seÃ±alados por el gremio.
â€œSe estaba avanzando en una posible construcciÃ³n de manera concertada del proyecto de reforma a la ley de servicios pÃºblicos, pero al ser conocida la Ãºltima versiÃ³n de este texto se siguen dando pasos atrÃ¡s sin tener en cuenta aspectos fundamentalesâ€, aÃ±adiÃ³.
Y es que la propuesta presentada en el borrador otorga al presidente la potestad directa para regular los servicios pÃºblicos, una medida que ha generado controversia. Tanto en medios como en sectores implicados, se debate sobre el grado de intervenciÃ³n que deberÃ­a tener el Estado en manejos que actualmente son mixtos.
Camilo SÃ¡nchez, presidente de Andesco y exministro de Vivienda, dejÃ³ claro que las tarifas de energÃ­a las regula la Creg - crÃ©dito Andesco Lo que permite el modelo regulador del paÃ­s En la actualidad, el modelo regulador del paÃ­s permite una coexistencia de diferentes tipos de empresas en el Ã¡mbito de los servicios pÃºblicos. SÃ¡nchez sostiene que esta diversidad es fundamental y que cambiar la regulaciÃ³n podrÃ­a generar desequilibrios. â€œEste es un proyecto que desconfÃ­a de la estructura regulatoria que tiene el paÃ­s y prÃ¡cticamente quiere abolirlaâ€, afirmÃ³. Las reglas actuales, defendidas por Andesco, buscan garantizar la competencia y la calidad del servicio, factores que podrÃ­an verse comprometidos con una mayor intervenciÃ³n estatal.
La preocupaciÃ³n principal radica en que el cambio propuesto podrÃ­a centralizar la regulaciÃ³n de servicios pÃºblicos, reduciendo la capacidad de otros actores para influir y participar en el proceso. SegÃºn el borrador, esta centralizaciÃ³n recaerÃ­a en manos del presidente de la RepÃºblica, lo que algunos interpretan como un retroceso en tÃ©rminos de transparencia y participaciÃ³n democrÃ¡tica. Camilo SÃ¡nchez destacÃ³ que â€œse siguen dando pasos atrÃ¡s sin tener en cuenta aspectos fundamentales que desde el gremio se habÃ­an seÃ±aladoâ€.

author: Petty Officer 3rd Class Alisha Gleason
title: MWR Holds Christmas 5K Run [Image 2 of 4]
text:
231225-N-AG075-1136
U.S. 5TH FLEET AREA OF OPERATIONS (Dec. 25, 2023) Wasp-class amphibious assault ship USS Bataan (LHD 5) Sailors and 26th Marine Expeditionary Unit (Special Operations Capable) Marines run in a Christmas 5k on the shipâ€™s flight deck, Dec. 25. Components of the Bataan Amphibious Ready Group and 26th Marine Expeditionary Unit (Special Operations Capable) are deployed to the U.S. 5th Fleet area of operations to help ensure maritime security and stability in the Middle East region. (U.S. Navy photo by Mass Communication Specialist 3rd Class Alisha Gleason)

Agora Ã© oficial: Geovany Quenda e DÃ¡rio Essugo sÃ£o jogadores do Chelsea . O extremo de 17 anos muda-se para a Premier League apenas no verÃ£o de 2026, o mÃ©dio de 20, atualmente cedido ao Las Palmas , jÃ¡ na prÃ³xima Ã©poca.

A Sporting Clube de Portugal â€“ Futebol, SAD (adiante Sporting SAD) vem, nos termos e para efeitos do cumprimento da obrigaÃ§Ã£o de informaÃ§Ã£o que decorre do disposto no artigo 17.Âº do Regulamento (UE) n.Âº 596/2014, do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 16 de Abril, prestar a seguinte informaÃ§Ã£o ao mercado:
A Sporting SAD chegou a um acordo global com o Chelsea Football Club Limited (adiante Chelsea FC) para a transferÃªncia, a tÃ­tulo definitivo, dos direitos desportivos dos jogadores Geovany Quenda e DÃ¡rio Essugo , pelo valor total de atÃ© â‚¬ 74.408.816,32 (setenta e quatro milhÃµes, quatrocentos e oito mil, oitocentos e dezasseis euros e trinta e dois cÃªntimos), ao qual correspondem encargos com os serviÃ§os de intermediaÃ§Ã£o de aproximadamente 6%, acordo este cujos termos e condiÃ§Ãµes essenciais se sumariam da seguinte forma:

1.1. A contrapartida financeira da transferÃªncia corresponde a â‚¬ 52.136.541,32 (cinquenta e dois milhÃµes, cento e trinta e seis mil, quinhentos e quarenta e um euros, trinta e dois cÃªntimos) que compreende uma parcela fixa de â‚¬ 50.777.700,00 (cinquenta milhÃµes, setecentos e setenta e sete mil e setecentos euros) e uma parcela variÃ¡vel que poderÃ¡ ascender a â‚¬ 1.358.841,32 (um milhÃ£o, trezentos e cinquenta e oito mil, oitocentos e quarenta e um euros e trinta e dois cÃªntimos) em funÃ§Ã£o da verificaÃ§Ã£o de determinados objectivos relacionados com o desempenho desportivo do jogador no decorrer da Ã©poca desportiva 2025/2026, sendo que o jogador continuarÃ¡ a prestar a sua actividade junto da Sporting SAD atÃ© ao final da Ã©poca desportiva 2025/2026;

2. DÃ¡rio Essugo
2.1. A contrapartida financeira da transferÃªncia, que se concretizarÃ¡ no termo na presente Ã©poca desportiva, corresponde a um montante fixo de â‚¬ 22.272.275,00 (vinte e dois milhÃµes, duzentos e setenta e dois mil, duzentos e setenta e cinco euros), sendo que o jogador continuarÃ¡ a prestar a sua actividade junto da UniÃ³n Desportiva Las Palmas atÃ© ao final da presente Ã©poca desportiva de 2024/2025, ficando a partir da Ã©poca 2025/2026 ao serviÃ§o do Chelsea FC;

2.3. Os encargos com os serviÃ§os de intermediaÃ§Ã£o correspondem a â‚¬ 999.687,00 (novecentos enoventa e nove mil, seiscentos e oitenta e sete euros).
